section.p: Before you can install the platform in OIDC authentication mode and/or create a tenant, a number of prerequisites and preparations are required in the relevant OIDC provider system.

The prerequisites are specific to the OIDC provider. The following descriptions use Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) as an example. If you intend to work with a different OIDC provider, please contact your support organization for details.
The following prerequisites and preparations are required at the OIDC provider:

ol.li:
An account and domain must exist to which you have access as an administrator.
Azure AD example: domain mydomain.onmicrosoft.com

A directory must exist in the domain, which contains at least all the users who are to work with the platform.
Azure AD example: directory Org

Relevant only for the first deployment of the platform: Create an access group named OSCM_PLATFORM_OPERATOR in the directory, and add the user who is to become the initial platform administrator as a member to the group.
Azure AD example: Create a security group, OSCM_PLATFORM_OPERATOR, in the directory Org. Add the initial administrator, e.g. oscmadmin@mydomain.onmicrosoft.comescmadmin@mydomain.onmicrosoft.com, as a member.Organizations in on the platform are mapped to groups at the OIDC provider. Each user can be a member of exactly one group only.

Register your platform installation as an application that connects to the OIDC provider directory.
Azure AD example: In the directory under App registrations, create a new registration with the following properties:
A name and supported account types of your choice.
Redirect URI: https://<host_fqdn>:9091/oscm-identity/callback
<host_fqdn> is the fully qualified name or IP address of the host to access your platform installation, 9091 is the port. Omit the port if is operated with its proxy.

Copy the ID of the new application for later use in on the platform.
Azure AD example: ef29bb22-369c-424d-9e72-6800ad24239e

Grant the application read and write permissions for the directory, users, and groups.
Azure AD example: In the properties of the new app, under API permissions:
Add the following permissions for the Microsoft Graph API as both, Delegated permissions and Application permissions: User.Read.All, Group.ReadWrite.All, Directory.ReadWrite.All.
Grant admin consent for the directory, Org, for the new permissions.

Obtain a client certificate or secret string for the platform to access the directory.
Azure AD example: In the properties of the new app, under Certificates and secrets, add a new client secret. Copy the new secret for later use in on the platform.

Allow the platform to obtain tokens for authentication from the OIDC provider.
Azure AD example: In the properties of the new app, under Authentication, enable Access tokens and ID tokens to be issued by the authorization endpoint.

section.p: You can now create and configure a tenant in in on the platform based on the items and settings in the OIDC provider system.
